speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: SCENE VI. Street near the city gate.

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Enter ISABELLA and MARIANA

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: To speak so indirectly I am loath:

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: I would say the truth; but to accuse him so,

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: That is your part: yet I am advised to do it;

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: He says, to veil full purpose.

speaker: MARIANA
text_entry: Be ruled by him.

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Besides, he tells me that, if peradventure

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: He speak against me on the adverse side,

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: I should not think it strange; for 'tis a physic

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: That's bitter to sweet end.

speaker: MARIANA
text_entry: I would Friar Peter--

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: O, peace! the friar is come.

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Enter FRIAR PETER

speaker: FRIAR PETER
text_entry: Come, I have found you out a stand most fit,

speaker: FRIAR PETER
text_entry: Where you may have such vantage on the duke,

speaker: FRIAR PETER
text_entry: He shall not pass you. Twice have the trumpets sounded;

speaker: FRIAR PETER
text_entry: The generous and gravest citizens

speaker: FRIAR PETER
text_entry: Have hent the gates, and very near upon

speaker: FRIAR PETER
text_entry: The duke is entering: therefore, hence, away!

speaker: FRIAR PETER
text_entry: Exeunt
